Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_glacierpointv2

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_yosemitev2 import OpenBMCYosemiteV2
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.lib.decorators import retry
import re


[docs]class OpenBMCGlacierPointV2(OpenBMCYosemiteV2):
    '''
    Sideband methods to execute on GPV2 server.
    '''

[docs]    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
        self.gpv2_slot = self.get_slot_for_gpv2()



[docs]    def get_slot_for_gpv2(self):
        """
        Glacier PointV2 is attached to a twinlake yosemitev2 host.
        The pairs are:
        Slot2 host -> Slot1 GPv2
        Slot4 host -> Slot3 GPv2
        Replacing slot id is necessary to run commands on GPv2
        through openbmc
        """
        if self.slot_info == "slot2":
            slot_info = "slot1"
        elif self.slot_info == "slot4":
            slot_info = "slot3"
        return slot_info



[docs]    def device_fru_list(self):
        '''
        execute fruid-util command on all the 12 pcie devices on gpv2
        returns fruid from all devices
        '''
        out = ""
        for i in range(0, 12):
            try:
                cmd = "/usr/local/bin/fruid-util %s device%d" % (self.gpv2_slot, i)
                out += self.bmc_host.run(cmd) + "\n"
            except Exception as e:
                AutovalUtils.log_info(e)
                pass
        return out



[docs]    def get_full_fruid_list(self):
        '''
        Extract and return
            all the YV2 server related fruid
            + GPV2 switch fruid
            + 12 devices fruid
        '''
        base = super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).get_full_fruid_list()
        base += "\n" + super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).fru_list(self.gpv2_slot)
        base += "\n" + self.device_fru_list()
        return base



[docs]    def get_fw_util_options(self):
        '''
        Return YV2 related fw-util + GPv2 slot fw-util
        '''
        base = super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).fw_util_bmc_nic_slot()
        base += "\n" + super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).fw_util(self.gpv2_slot)
        return base



[docs]    def fw_update_glacierpoint_bic(self, bmc_binary_file_path):
        """
        This function performs bic fw-update of the gpv2 switch slot
        Return value of this function is the console output of fw-update command
        """
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --update --bic %s" % (self.gpv2_slot, bmc_binary_file_path)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def fw_update_glacierpoint_bicbl(self, bmc_binary_file_path):
        """
        This function performs bicbl fw-update of the gpv2 switch slot
        Return value of this function is the console output of fw-update command
        """
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --update --bicbl %s" % (self.gpv2_slot, bmc_binary_file_path)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    @retry(tries=3, sleep_seconds=5, exponential=True)
    def get_glacierpoint_bic_version(self):
        '''
        Retrieves the GPv2 slot Bridge-IC Version
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --version" % self.gpv2_slot
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)

        # Get the BIC version from fw-util output
        match = re.search(r"Bridge-IC\sVersion:\s(\w+.\w+)", out)
        if match:
            return match.group(1)
        else:
            raise Exception("Failed to get BRIDGE IC version")



[docs]    @retry(tries=3, sleep_seconds=5, exponential=True)
    def get_glacierpoint_bicbl_version(self):
        '''
        Retrieves the GPv2 slot Bridge-IC Bootloader Version
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --version" % self.gpv2_slot
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)

        # Get the BICbl version from fw-util output
        match = re.search(r"Bridge-IC\sBootloader\sVersion:\s(\w+.\w+)", out)
        if match:
            return match.group(1)
        else:
            raise Exception("Failed to get BIC bootloader version")



[docs]    def get_cpld_glacierpoint_fw_version(self):
        '''
        Retrieves the GPv2 slot CPLD Version
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --version" % (self.gpv2_slot)
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        # Get the CPLD FW version from fw-util output
        match = re.search(r"CPLD\sVersion:\s(\d+x\d+)", out)
        if match:
            return match.group(1)
        else:
            raise Exception("Failed to get CPLD FW version")



[docs]    def fw_update_glacierpoint_cpld(self, bmc_binary_file_path):
        '''
        Executes the cpld fw update for GPv2 switch slot
        Executes the ac_cycle(gpv2 slot)
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --update --cpld %s" % (
            self.gpv2_slot,
            bmc_binary_file_path
        )
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        self.ac_cycle(slot=self.gpv2_slot)
        return out



[docs]    def get_pciesw_fw_version(self):
        '''
        Retrieves the GPv2 slot pcie_sw Version
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --version" % self.gpv2_slot
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        # Get the pcie_sw FW version from fw-util output
        match = re.search(r"PCIE\sswitch\sVersion:\s(\d+x\d+)", out)
        if match:
            return match.group(1)
        else:
            raise Exception("Failed to get PCIE switch Version:")



[docs]    def fw_update_pcie_switch(self, bmc_binary_file_path):
        '''
        Executes the pcie_sw fw update for GPv2 switch slot
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/bin/"
        cmd += "fw-util %s --update --pcie_sw %s" % (
            self.gpv2_slot,
            bmc_binary_file_path
        )
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def log_util_gpv2(self):
        '''
        Executes and returns the log-util output on GPv2 switch slot
        '''
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "log-util %s --print" % self.gpv2_slot
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def log_util_all_options(self):
        '''
        Returns log-util output for host slot + GPv2 slot
        '''
        logs = super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).log_util_all_options()
        logs.append(self.log_util_gpv2())
        return logs



[docs]    def gpv2power(self, host, cycle_type, timeout=1200):
        '''
        executes the cycle tests for GPv2 switch slot.
        12V-cycle, 12V-on and 12V-off are valid for GPv2 slot.
        other cycle types should be tested under negative testing with
            not supported message.
        '''
        cycle_options = ["cycle", "off", "on", "graceful-shutdown", "reset"]
        if cycle_type == 'all_non_12V_cycle':
            for option in cycle_options:
                self.gpv2_negative_cycle(reboot_type=option)
        elif cycle_type == 'ac':
            super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).ac_cycle(slot=self.gpv2_slot)
        elif cycle_type == 'ac_on_off_fullcycle':
            super(OpenBMCGlacierPointV2, self).ac_on_off_fullcycle(
                slot=self.gpv2_slot
            )
        else:
            raise TestError("Unknown GPv2 power-util option %s" % cycle_type)



[docs]    def gpv2_negative_cycle(self, timeout=1200, reboot_type=None):
        '''
        Check negative test to make sure GPv2 returns error
        '''
        if reboot_type is None:
            raise TestError("Unknown reboot_type for cycling %s" % self.gpv2_slot)
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "power-util %s %s" % (self.gpv2_slot, reboot_type)

        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing negative test : Cycling now : {}".format(cmd))
        ret = self.bmc_host.run(
            cmd,
            timeout=timeout,
            get_result_obj=True,
            ignore_status=True
        )
        # return code for reset command is 0; checking for fail in stdout instead:
        if ret.return_code == 254 or "fail" in ret.stdout:
            #Check if following STDOUT is found :
            #"Should not execute power on/off/graceful_shutdown/cycle/reset
            #on device card":
            for line in ret.stdout.splitlines():
                if re.search(r'^Should.*card$', line):
                    return True
            raise TestError("Failed message not found while executing {}\n{}"
                .format(cmd, ret.stdout))
        else:
            raise TestError("Failed power-cycle GPv2 slot %s" % self.gpv2_slot)
